Title.evidence: The Optimal Prophylactic Method for Venous Thromboembolism After Gastrectomy in Korean Patients (PROTECTOR) randomized clinical trial

Trial_Design.evidence: randomized clinical trial was conducted between August 1, 2011, and March 31, 2015

Participants.evidence: Patients with histologically confirmed gastric adenocarcinoma presenting to a single center (Seoul St Mary’s Hospital in Seoul, South Korea) were enrolled

Intervention.evidence: Patients were randomized to either an intermittent pneumatic compression (IPC)–only group or an IPC+low-molecular-weight (LMW) heparin sodium group

Objective.evidence: To evaluate the incidence of postgastrectomy VTE in Korean patients with gastric adenocarcinoma, and to identify the complications and evaluate the efficacy and safety of VTE prevention methods

Method_Outcome.evidence: Venous thromboembolism incidence was the primary outcome

Number_Randomised.evidence: Of the 682 patients enrolled and randomized

Number_Analysed.evidence: Among the 666 patients included in the analysis, the overall incidence of VTE was 2.1%

Result_Outcome.evidence: The incidence of VTE was statistically significantly higher in the IPC-only group compared with the IPC+LMW heparin group (3.6%; 95% CI, 2.05%-6.14% vs 0.6%; 95% CI, 0.17%-2.18%; P = .008)

Harms.evidence: The overall incidence of bleeding complications was 5.1%
